job description:
SCIENTIST - IMMUNOLOGY
IRVINE, CA

Project Description:
  • Executes the development and qualification of analytical methods for the biologics drug product development with an emphasis on SMCxPRO (Singulex Erenna) immunoassay.
  • Creates written procedures and protocols.
  • Responsible for creating detailed project plans including scientific strategy. Actively involved in the planning, execution and management of experimental studies.
  • Organizes, schedules and participates in project team meetings to define and schedule project activities and review completed tasks.
  • Communicates project status to supervisor, and/or project team leader,
  • Writes, reviews and issues technical reports, technical memoranda and other documents for internal and external distribution.
Required Skills:
  • Ph.D. and 2+ years of industry experience or Master's degree and 4+ years of industry experience. Degree in a related scientific or engineering discipline (cell biology, molecular biology, immunology or similar).
  • Experience in a developing immunoassay with a proven record of success in conducting R&D projects.
  • Must have a thorough working knowledge of a wide range of analytical methods (i.e. Singulex Erenna, SMCxPRO, Luminex, ELISA, MSD).
  • Ability to independently develop new and innovative analytical methods, improving existing ones, and troubleshoot product quality problems.
  • Previous experience with biologics and/ or hydrogels is a plus.
  • Strong ability to evaluate and interpret analytical results and lead investigations to resolve analytical issues is required.
  • Proficient in writing technical reports, protocols, and procedures.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, strong scientific leadership skills, ability to work effectively in independent and team settings, and acute attention to detail are essential skills for this position.
  • Working knowledge in analytical development.
  • Must be knowledgeable using statistical programs for analytical data evaluation.
  • Ability to critically review and evaluate analytical data and make conclusions/recommendations based on data.
  • Must possess good interpersonal skills, the ability to work in a dynamic team environment and must multi-task to meet project timelines.
This 7+ month position starts ASAP.

MUST BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE U.S. AS AN HOURLY W2 EMPLOYEE
